level.description: You now have access to the <color=#ff00ffff>WARPER</color> tool. You can use the <color=#ff00ffff>WARPER</color> tool to travel from function to function. Use the <color=#ff00ffff>WARPER</color> tool on any line of <color=#ff00ffff>purple</color> text. You can use TAB to switch between tools.
level.introtext: There are two new tools to learn: <color=#ff00ffff>WARPERS</color> help move through code <color=#00ff00ff>COMMENTERS</color> identify if code is buggy. You will need both of these to succeed!
level.endtext: You found the bug with a Divide-and-Conquer approach! Now two new tools are yours! Can you put them both to good use?
level.tech: The bug is somewhere in this code, but it could take a long time to do code tracing. Use your tools to check different sections of code. If the bug persists when you comment something out, it must be somewhere else.
level.hint1: When you use the LOCK tool, it tells you what type of error you have, and where the bug is NOT located.
level.hint2: If the error is in the DoMoreStuff function, then look for the block of code that makes the bug disappear when you comment it out.
